content.description: A factory produces bags of rubber bands. A bag of rubber bands has five different sizes: extra large <math alttext="X L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>XL</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, large <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mstyle><mrow><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>, medium <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(M)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, small <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>S</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and extra small <math alttext="X S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>XS</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. A quality control specialist collects a random sample of 450 rubber bands from the bagging machine and calculates a chi-square goodness-of-fit test to see if the frequencies for each size in the sample match the hypothesized distribution. The quality control specialist will test his sample against the following null hypothesis.<math alttext="H sub 0: p sub X L equals 0.10, p sub L equals 0.20, p sub M equals 0.40, p sub S equals 0.20, p sub X S equals 0.10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>XL</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.10</mn><mo>,</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.20</mn><mo>,</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>M</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.40</mn><mo>,</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.20</mn><mo>,</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>X</mtext><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.10</mn></mrow></math>
content.question: How many medium rubber bands are expected in the random sample of 450 rubber bands?

topic.text: 8.2: Setting up a Chi-Square Goodness of Fit Test

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine relative frequencies, proportions, or probabilities using simulation or calculations.
